title: Who's your favorite champion, storywise?
body:
I really like the newfound lines of communication between Riot and us, and I'd like to keep this type of discussion. Let's see if we can attract a few more Rioters to this forum.

So, who is your favorite champion, storywise? And why?

Personally, my favorite is Quinn (and Valor). Her story is absolutely amazing -- she is a highly ranked soldier in a place where your caste determines everything. Her very existence is probably a cause of conflict among Demacian nobles. (I have a headcanon where the only reason why Quinn was allowed to do what she does today is that Prince Jarvan IV created a new position just for her, so she could continue to serve Demacia to the best of her abilities.) Plus, I like the concept between having a giant bird of prey as a companion.

Quinn also has interesting connections to Talon. They have remarkably similar fashion senses, and she seems familiar with his assassination style. I can't tell whether I want them to have a sibling-friendly-rivalry or romantic relationship, though. I can't go further with any headcanons about that until I decide which one seems like a better fit. (Riot please at least tell me if Talon is Caleb!)

Riven. I highly enjoy the fact that she forced herself to wield giant swords just to prove how goddamn Noxian she was, and determined she was to stay that way up until her final battle in the Noxian military. The moral conflict at that point is also something I find really interesting. Yes, she did slaughter countless Ionians, but she believed it be for a just cause, the Noxian cause: that they were simply stronger than they were and that's just how it goes. And yeah, it wasn't until her own troops started to drop like flies did she realize that this whole thing just was not working out for her. (granted her league judgement does state that she and her men didn't particularly want to dispatch civilians, they were just kind of ordered to, but still) Also I dig the whole, "I'm gonna ditch my past ideals and since my sword is the symbol of those past ideals, I'mma break it!" thing.

Yasuo's lore I like because apparently he was a prideful prick about his mastery over the wind technique of his school and that later came to bite him in the ass when no one even tried to defend him when accused of murdering the Elder. Not even his brother, like damn D:

Riven is my favorite story-wise too, for the reasons you called out. Specifically, there are two lines from her judgment that really cemented this for me. As she's fighting through the ambush:

> The Ionians had the advantage, but Riven wasn’t one to surrender. If they could defeat her in combat, they deserved this victory. The strong *would* prevail.

This to me is the "pure" Noxian value to which Riven holds. The strong will survive, whoever that turns out to be. I like that Riven goes into battle with that mindset, and knows that she may someday find that she isn't the strongest.

But then, the Zaun death machines open fire:

> *Only the strong survive*, she repeated… but that was meaningless here. Nobody would survive. By all rights, the Ionians should have won this fight, but they too would die. How did this follow the Noxian way?

To me, this is when she realizes that Noxus - her Noxus - is broken, so she shatters her sword to match it. But I like to think that she keeps the fragments with her. I think she believes that while Noxus is broken, that it doesn't have to be. After all...

> What is broken can be reforged.

I can't wait to see what happens between Riven and Yasuo when they do finally meet up. These two are my favorite characters lore-wise simply for the inevitable meet up. I just hope it doesn't end to the point that one of them has to die >.< While Riven's at fault for ruining Yasuo's life, it was Yasuo who abandoned his post and is rightly to blame for those events that happen to him.

/secretly shipping Riven x Yasuo O.o

I find the whole Riven/Yasuo thing interesting. To me it's one of those things where Yasuo would take it really personally, and want to enact personal vengeance. But for Riven, it's just part of the mission. "Just another Tuesday", if you will. I can see Yasuo confronting her, and Riven just kind of shrugging it off like "oh, I guess I did kill that guy? Noxian orders, sorry 'bout it."

Of course, we don't actually know for sure that it was Riven who killed his master. Certainly seems plausible - I can see a confrontation coming, regardless of the truth here - but Riven could be totally innocent of that.

Riven + Yasuo is an interesting pairing (shipping or otherwise), so I hope she isn't responsible; I don't think Yasuo would ever be able to move past it if she was.

If Riven wasn't the one responsible I hope she's still tied to Yasuo's story somehow. It would be so anticlimactic if the killer wasn't Riven and then her storyline that crossed with Yasuo's was over just like that. These two are wandering the land - for different purposes of course - and are both very similar in a lot of ways. If she wasn't the killer, then I hope whoever was gives Riven a reason to hunt him/her/it down with Yasuo.

Oh boy, oh boy. Be prepared for a long-ass rant.

{{champion:254}}  got me into the game before I even realized what League of Legends was. That and my friends/boyfriend invited me to play, but I've seen Vi around a lot on the Internet beforehand and was immediately hooked on her character.

I'm a huge sucker for people who are tough on the outside but complete softies/do-gooders at heart. I loved the complexity of Vi's character past her punching - the fact that she used to be a criminal and had a change of heart at such a young age meant that she wasn't inherently malicious, she was probably sticking with the group to scrape by and survive. She's a kid prodigy at hextech, while at the same time being physically powerful enough to defend herself/fight even without her gauntlets. And let's face it, she probably has the ~~worst~~ best fashion sense in all of Runeterra (srsly rito do you know how much of a pain it is to cosplay Vi with like her half-tutu-thing and her backpack and her boots ~~wheredidsheevengetthemfrom~~)

Jokes aside, I think Vi's super underrated when not viewed from the perspective of her rivalry with Jinx. She's headstrong, stubborn, overconfident and cocky, but also actively trying to reform and atone for her past - besides being part of the Piltover PD she's seen with a lollipop in her concept art, which I headcanon as being one of her coping mechanisms for weaning off her habit of smoking, which shows how much she wants to change. Even her fashion sense says something about her - she's most likely scrapped together all that armor by herself, and they seem to be worn in places where she must've had been injured before (for example, the knee protector on one knee and the brace on the other - I like to think that she injured herself from her left knee down and didn't want it to happen to her other leg). That to me is character development.

One thing that gets me is how Ekko's voice lines hint at some expanded backstory on Vi. I think Gypsylord mentioned that due to trauma in her childhood she has amnesia (though I don't know from which point on, because she doesn't seem to remember Jinx ~~and that they're both sisters _cough_~~), which when coupled with how Ekko addresses her (as someone he looked up to once, was disappointed in, and as a Zaunite?????) makes for a very intriguing, colorful past...

I don't just love the living heck out of Vi, I identify with her as a character. She's got some battle scars, dude, but hell, she's fighting as much for a better tomorrow as Jayce is. I wish more people would appreciate her as she is beyond her relationship with Caitlyn/her rivalry with Jinx/her expanded rivalry with Ekko??? She feels more fleshed-out to me than the other champs in the game, or perhaps that's just because I'm biased towards the underdogs of society :P She's cocky and confident in her abilities, but she has her insecurities; she's actively trying to make herself a better person, but in her own way (though I don't doubt that Cait could be one of the reasons why); she's got a great sense of humor :D; and despite how much she teases Cait, she seems like the kind of friendly person anyone would warm up to (well, if they're not completely off their rockers like Jinx) judging from her lines for Cait and Jayce. Her lore isn't where her story ends; it's everything from her story to her lines to her character design to the way other characters interact with her that paint a picture of her as a person, not just another champ on the Rift. I feel like a lot of it is reduced to her identity as Jinx's rival after Jinx was released, and the "canon" lesbian in the League (that is still sexualized to some extent - like the boobs on her Officer skin and her skintight Neon Strike skin - but I think Debonair is a step in a better direction, though I've had enough of the community calling her a dyke and reducing her character to just that.)

Big kudos to Riot and Gypsylord for creating a character I genuinely care about and identify with, in a way I haven't felt about a fictional character in a long while. As a girl growing up loving games and presented with strong male archetypes as protagonists, Vi is a breath of fresh air and the depth of her character feels empowering. I do play a lot of Leona, Sejuani, Soraka, Diana, etc. but Vi is someone I can relate to - you can be female and punch faces in, you can be strong, and you can be smart, even if it's not the kind of "smart" that society would normally think of.

I didn't really get "into" the game until Debonair Vi came out (that's when I decided to say "fuck it" and drop my money on getting Vi and her skin, back when my account was level 10-15 or so), and since then I've been playing her top and jungle until my account was 30, and only then I've branched out and tried other champions (because I kept getting beaten in lane as toplane Vi lol). I don't play her as much anymore, and thanks to Mata's incredible showing at last year's Worlds I've taken a shining to the support role, but Vi continues to be my #1 favorite champ.

Once again thank you Riot and thank you Gypsy for making such an awesome character :D

But I completely agree with you, I think {{champion:254}} is one of the most awesome characters ever made in fiction, her back story is interesting and mysterious, she is a complete blast to play, and her personality and sense of humor are awesome.  I mean, she puts the PUN in PUNch for crying out loud!  Also she's left-handed, which is both rare for video game characters and extremely awesome!  And its also cool how she goes through all that turmoil in her past and still wants to do good (Of course, as long as it involves punching bad people in the face, but still).

Yes, it is a shame when she is written off or reduced for the reasons you mentioned.  When I first saw {{champion:254}} , I didn't think she was a lesbian (just incredibly punk rock).  I was just blown away by her overall design: she was both jarring and awesome to look at.  But the more i saw her interactions with {{champion:51}}  just made me realize how adorable of a couple they would make, if not a little bit comedic as well XD.  But it's whatever, the fact is that people are going to speculate or write characters off based on things people think ( poor {{champion:44}} is an example). Vi is awesome regardless of her sexuality.

I could go on saying how awesome she is, but it would basically be a rehash of what you already said, so you already beat me to the PUNch! (sorry -_-)

What especially amazes and interests me about her lore is the "VI" tattoo or brand under her left eye.  GypsyLord said that she had it for as long as she can remember, and that it actually is the roman numeral for 6, and that her name Vi comes from it, not the other way around.  

This then begs the question: Who would tattoo or brand a large number onto an extremely young child's face, where everyone can see it, and why?  

Was she a slave?  Was she a biological experiment of some kind?  Is it related to that gear tattoo or brand on her neck?  And of course it said she was orphaned, how?  And why is she out on the streets in the first place?  Was she abandoned there or did she escape something?  And is she actually more from piltover, or zaun?  And she apparently has a sister, is she by blood or bond or some other common factor they both share?  Maybe related to the tattoos?  Maybe to the numbers?...wait we do know a champ who signs her names with an X (or a 10 in roman numerals, if it is in fact, a roman numeral)...{{champion:222}} ?  Maybe...maybe not

 And we know that {{champion:51}}  was looking for a criminal who left a card with the letter C on it, which could either be the roman numeral for 100, or just, you know, the letter...

And will whomever put that number on her face in the first place eventually be revealed as a new champion?  Will they look at Vi and say  "Hello number 6, we missed you!"?

Is this building to anything?  It could be cool :D

So I also want to shout out to GypsyLord for making one of the most awesome characters in fiction ever!  You are awesome, and so is Vi!!!!!
And sorry, this turned out longer than I thought it would be -_-

{{champion:127}}. She's like the only one who has her shit together. She has a plan and she has all the time in the world to make sure it's done right. She's patient, years spent getting everything ready for the eventual return of the Frozen Watchers. And even if they don't return, she's amassed  enough power to definitely do some damage. 

Up next is {{champion:112}} who was hurt so bad (emotionally) that be began replacing his own body with his inventions. Now no one can steal his creations.

{{champion:115}} tried to hard to impress those he respected and looked up to, only to result in them looking down on him. Even still, he came to their aid. He CHOSE to save them, even after everything that's happened. True hero, this one.

{{champion:110}} Varus, man... Poor guy. Seriously... these kinds of decisions are hard to make and either way you're screwed. 

{{champion:63}} Brand isn't evil. He's wildfire. He wants to cleanse this world of the corruption of humanity and science to make way for a new world. And in the words of Parthurnax, "Who are we to stop the birth of the new world?". Brand is that force, a force of nature (or a creation during the rune wars) that seeks to stop the destruction of the world my cleansing it with fire. Seriously, google "wildfire and plant life diversity". It's the same concept.

{{champion:134}} Holding her back was like pulling back a rubber band. Something's gonna snap. When she learned what they were doing to her, it didn't sit too well with her. 

Just some of my favorites simply because of their lore. Lore defines a champion, gives them purpose. I like to know what drives them.

{{champion:112}}. He was a man that had his life's work stolen from him simply because of the greed of another. He fell into depression, and was no longer able to face the world. But even then he wanted to make the world a better place. So he did what he did best: He built something. Something that could remove the sadness and anger that was consuming him, something that could ensure nobody had to suffer ever again. 
 
But emotion clouded his judgement. He couldn't remove his sadness, anger, and resentment. He simply transformed it. And this transformation consumed him more literally than emotion ever could. This transformation became his obsession. And in his obsession he came to a realization that would change everything. Humans are broken. Not just emotionally, not just physically, everything about their existence is flawed. And what does an engineer do with flaws? He fixes them.
TF and Nautilus... though there is so much room for development with both of them.

Used to be Trundle.

A naïve kid, always bullied by his peers, made fun of. The runt of the tribe. Suddenly it is discovered he is special, he is offered a chance to save his entire tribe, become a hero for eternity. 

Eagerly he takes it.

He is praised by his entire tribe. They all love him and praise him for his noble sacrifice. Nothing could be better for Trundle.

Then his tribe starts shunning him.

His tribe, now over the initial gratitude of their new hero, starts shunning Trundle for what he has become after his sacrifice. For Trundle, he is back to square one, the runt of the tribe. Except for one thing. No longer is Trundle the naïve kid. He leaves his tribe, embittered by his experience, cynical by what he learned.

***

New Trundle basically never learns. He takes the opportunity to save his tribe, gain their adoration, and he himself turns hungry for more. He is just a power-hungry brute and his VO reflects this accurately. in his old VO you could hear Trundles pain, physically and emotionally. His new one oozes the hunger for power.
